items.title: Which insurance players will be impacted most and least by GST exemptions?
items.description: The move will lower insurance premiums for policyholders and prospective buyers, encourage greater insurance penetration, and provide a significant boost to the industry

items.title: GST reset fuels demand hopes: M&M, Maruti, Hero Moto, Escorts, Ashok Leyland among beneficiaries
items.description: India’s auto industry is gearing up for an early festive boost after the GST Council rolled out sweeping tax cuts on small cars, SUVs, two-wheelers, tractors, and commercial vehicles. Analysts expect the move to trigger a 5 to 10 percent surge in demand and reset growth expectations across the sector

items.title: Poly Medicure shares in focus on acquisition of Netherlands based company
items.description: Poly Medicure Share Price | The company is goint to acquire 90 percent stake in PendraCare Group.

items.title: GST boost for FMCG companies to drive demand recovery, sector re-rating
items.description: Lower taxes on daily essentials, packaged food, and oral and personal care categories will revive consumption

items.title: Consumer durables get a GST lift — Which players will lead the charge?
items.description: A lower GST rate sets the stage for a demand revival in consumer durables

items.title: Cement companies to benefit from GST rate cut, favourable cost outlook
items.description: Lower tax on cement and stable production costs should benefit cement companies. However, does it change the investment outlook for cement majors?

items.title: GST rate cuts to benefit players across the healthcare sector
items.description: Rates have been pruned for drugs used in chronic diseases as also medical devices and hospital chains

items.title: What GST rate cuts for the ‘Common Man’ mean for consumer categories, companies
items.description: GST rationalisation strengthens the consumption story by boosting affordability, accelerating the shift to organised players and creating volume-led earnings tailwinds

items.title: GST Reforms: Who wins big in the textile market shake-up?
items.description: The rate cut should lower procurement costs, improve cost efficiency, and enhance operating margins

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description:
Gold held near an all-time high after a seven-day rally, as weak US data spurred more bets on an
interest-rate cut by the Federal Reserve this month and mounting concerns over the central bank’s independence underpinned haven demand.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: Nifty opens above 24,900, Sensex up 600 pts; BHEL, Aptus Value Housing, FMCG, auto stocks in focus
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: Bajaj Finance, HUL, Grasim Industries, Bajaj Finserv, Trent are among major gainers on the Nifty, while losers are NTPC, Reliance Industries, Hindalco Industries, HCL Technologies, ONGC.

items.title: Asian stocks rise as weak US jobs fuel Fed bets
items.description: Australian bonds tracked Wednesday’s moves in Treasuries, with yields on the 10-year declining almost five basis points to 4.37%.

items.title: Markets likely to react positively to GST booster dose for FMCG, auto, insurance, consumer durables and MSMEs, say experts
items.description: Experts say that the decision of merging GST rates into 5% and 18% -- while reserving 40% for sin goods -- will benefit many sectors like FMCG, auto, insurance, consumer durables and MSMEs among others ahead of the festive season.

items.title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade Coal India, ITC Hotels, GMDC, Pondy Oxides, Paytm, Glenmark Pharma, HDFC Bank, and others on September 04?

items.title: Stocks to Watch Today: Aptus Value Housing, BHEL, Swiggy, Poly Medicure, Sharika Enterprises, BlueStone Jewellery, GHV Infra in focus on 04 September
items.description: Stocks to Watch, 04 September: Stocks like Aptus Value Housing Finance India, BHEL, Swiggy, Poly Medicure, Sharika Enterprises, BlueStone Jewellery, GHV Infra Projects, Redington, and Highway Infrastructure will be in focus on September 4.
